alert.note: Alert for Brown; Marshall; Nemaha; Republic; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 10 at 2:48PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Republic, Washington, Marshall, Nemaha and Brown Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday afternoon through Friday morning. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
